alert.note: Alert for Imperial (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued July 23 at 12:48AM PDT until July 23 at 2:15AM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Southwestern La Paz County in west central Arizona... Central Yuma County in southwestern Arizona... Imperial County in southeastern California... * Until 215 AM MST/215 AM PDT/. * At 1247 AM MST/1247 AM PDT, a wall of dust was along a line extending from near Martinez Lake to near Algodones Dunes to 20 miles west of San Luis, moving northwest at 40 mph. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 8 between mile markers 1 and 50. CA Interstate 8 near mile marker 1, and between mile markers 4 and 96. AZ Route 95 between mile markers 29 and 87. Locations impacted include... Yuma, El Centro, Calexico, Brawley, Imperial, Somerton, Plaster City, Martinez Lake, Salton City, Fortuna Foothills, Ocotillo, Gadsden, San Luis, Holtville, and Wellton. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
